item.title: Securing your Code for Production
item.description: Defense in depth is a concept where you implement multiple overlapping layers of security to provide protection even if one layer is compromised. Traditionally security was implemented at endpoints, for instance, a firewall controlling network traffic and email filtering. A defense in depth approach would filter emails at the firewall and through anti-virus software on the desktops. Why install the desktop software on desktops when the firewall is filtering emails?
